alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Waseca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 10:17AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN BLUE EARTH AND NORTHERN WASECA COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 AM CDT... At 1017 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Good Thunder, or 13 miles south of Mankato, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Waseca, Janesville, Mapleton, St. Clair, Elysian, Good Thunder, Vernon Center, Pemberton, Waseca Airport, Alma City, and Smiths Mill. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 142 and 163. U.S. Highway 169 near mile marker 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
